basics.name: Tommy Parnell
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: My name is Tommy Parnell, I have a bachelors degree from Southern New Hampshire University. I am currently working for vistaprint.com as a Software Engineer. My current interest is with nodejs, dotnet core, and docker

work.summary: I work on the gallery team at Vistaprint. We own anything that could be a gallery, and keyword search.
highlights: Built on React.js, ES6, and Redux. I worked on our very client side heavy SPA.
Maintained and improved our dotnet, and dotnet core based backends
I lead the charge on our transition to the cloud brining in Terraform and Docker for our microservices, and utilizing Puppet, and Packer for our non-dockerized systems

work.summary: DevOps Engineer, Technical lead for our monitoring team.
highlights: Wrote and maintained a custom monitoring platform written in C#
Wrote our own version of pagerduty in C#
Created tooling to support the uptime of our infrastructure

work.summary: Work on everything from helpdesk to our vmware cluster.

awards.title: C# Specialist (Programming in c# 70-483)
awards.summary: Covers advanced topics with c# such as the TPL, Diagnostics, Data access, Security and Eventing

awards.title: MSFT Technology Associate (.NET Fundamentals 98-372)
awards.summary: Covers JIT compilation, OO design and the BCL in the .NET stack

awards.title: Fiber Optic Technician
awards.summary: Basics of fiber cabling, and design.

awards.title: Certified Fiber Optic Specialist /H (CFxT)
awards.summary: Specializing in Last mile fiber architecture.

awards.title: Advanced Fiber Optics Technician (AFOT)
awards.summary: Advanced Fiber topics include Fusion Splicing, Architecting major fiber roll-outs, Optical Time Delay Reflectors

references.name: Raghu Venkatesh
references.reference: Tommy is smart, motivated and committed to his priorities and goals. He is eager to learn new tecnologies/standards and also works towards suggestions and implementations for best practices. He has displayed expertise in .NET development and has contributed in different tools that we used on daily basis.

references.name: Irwin Bramson
references.reference: I have known Tommy Parnell over the period of several years while he was a student at SNHU. He took several mathematics courses with me and I did get to know him extremely well. I have very vivid recollections of him. This young man is exceptionally bright, articulate, and a pleasure to have in class. He is extremely helpful as a student who followed my lectures effortlessly and occasionally corrected my mistakes. He is very friendly, well respected by his peers, and does not hesitate to help someone struggling with a mathematical concept that he can explain well.
